New Records: Glenn Maxwell struck the fastest century in World Cup history, reaching his hundred in just 40 balls.
Australia registered the biggest World Cup victory by winning with a margin of 309 runs.
David Warner hit his second successive century in the tournament.
Adam Zampa picked four wickets for eight runs in three overs.
Key Match Events: Australia won the toss and opted to bat first.
David Warner started strong by hitting four consecutive fours against Aryan Dutt.
Logan van Beek dismissed Mitchell Marsh early in the game.
David Warner and Steve Smith both scored half-centuries.
Aryan Dutt dismissed Steve Smith, ending his partnership with David Warner.
Glenn Maxwell hit the fastest World Cup century in 40 balls.
Logan van Beek took back-to-back wickets, dismissing Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Starc.
Pat Cummins finished Australia's innings with a four.
Each of the Australian pacers picked wickets against the Dutch top-order.
Warner made a leaping catch at square leg to dismiss Sybrand Engelbrecht.
Australia bowled out the Netherlands for 90 in 21 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's campaign has been inconsistent, with initial losses to South Africa and India, but they bounced back to defeat Pakistan and Sri Lanka.
The Netherlands have proven to be formidable opponents, having defeated South Africa in the tournament's opening round.
The Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium has undergone a transformation, making it a batter-friendly ground.
Both teams will be calculating their strategies meticulously, taking the pitch conditions into account.
Post-Match Reflections: The Netherlands dropped from seventh to 10th in the table, with two points and below Sri Lanka, defending champions England, and Bangladesh on run rate.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium has hosted 29 ODIs, with 14 won by the team batting first and 14 by the team chasing.
A moment of silence was observed for former Indian cricketer Bishan Singh Bedi, who passed away on October 23.
David Warner, who plays for the Delhi Capitals in the IPL, was expected to receive enthusiastic support from the Delhi crowd.
